texts: Old pond
A frog leaps
Sound of water
Last mountain autumn
A swiss, a wet deer walks
before the taxman
Timber wintertime
A gray, strong squirrel slithers
at the perfect branch
Cheery summertime
A vast, thundery sea flaps
in spite of the calm
I am sorry I've been such a grump
To be honest I feel like a chump
But I hope you can see
that it's not you, it's me
I'm in love with the Mighty Black Stump
There once was an Aussie named Brady
Who had the same name as a lady
Met a Yankee called Grey
And said to him hey
Let's talk on the internet maybe
There once was a robot called Grey
And you might find it odd when I say
Though he loved automation,
flags and education
He always led Brady astray
They may both have a passion for flagging
And some freebooting had their hearts sagging
But when they asked around
They surprisingly found
That they're known for the term humblebragging
The teacher shudders at the empty duck
He wants to leave but she wants the truck.
See the eating of the teacher,
I think he's angry at the feature.
She's not alone she brings a lorry,
a pet chimpanzee, and lots of inventory.
Who is that frightening near the spouse?
I think she'd like to eat the slaughterhouse.
